content.description: Located on the SW arete and crosses through Sweet Nebula to top out on the other side. An easier version with a little different climbing then Sweet Nebula. Sit start on a sidepulls under arete and head to jugs on west face.
content.location: SW arete start under roof on south side and climb to top out on the west side.

content.description: Sit start on big rails and head through small crimps to a difficult mantle.
content.location: The Southeast arete roof of The Mothership Boulder.

content.description: Sit start under small roof on ledge(same deep start as Jean-Luc) and make big first move to lip. From lip traverse a little left on the face to pocket and proceed to top out.
content.location: NW arete of boulder. Start under roof on bottom ledge. Follow through obvious holds to the left after the lip that help you to top out.

content.description: Sit start on bottom ledge under the SW arete roof of the boulder. Head out on great holds to the apex of the arete and top out on the south face.
content.location: Start on bottom ledge under the SW arete roof.

content.description: Start sitting on deepest rail of the NW arete roof and head through rails to set up to long move to flake at lip. Please hit on the right side of this flake because of risk of braking. V3 if you sit start on rails straight below flake, V3+ if you start from deeper right rail which adds 3 more moves.
content.protection: 1 crashpad and spotter to protect tree behind climber
content.location: NW arete area of the boulder under the main roof.

content.description: Start sitting on bottom ledge of the left side of the roof and go out the roof on a pocket and good holds with bad feet.
content.location: Sit start left side of main roof.

content.description: Almost completely overhanging on all sides (vary rare for PDC) with good quality holds in between choss. North Face is tallest at about 12 ft and the South Face is around 6-7 ft. 4-6 unique problems exist on the boulder.
